3) POTUS is the Commander of DC guard since 1803, and acts as Gov of DC in that respect, and can use them as any Gov would.  Yes the Guard surrounded the Lincoln Memorial, and it remained free of vandalism, unlike the WW2 memorial a few days prior. Wish they had been there.

2)  Guard officers like me have both a Federal and State commission.  President can call the Guard to federal service for war, (Guard bore a lot of the war burden since 2001), and other areas, but not for riots.  Governors can.

1)  Sadly, the Guard issue needs a thread:  The Guard started as a bunch of farmers who won our independence from the British.  The Guard is under the command of each governor, in the current moment many Democratic govs have called up their Guard.  Not partisan.

This moment demands our attention. No one can afford to ignore what is happening or sit this fight out. With so much work to do, it can feel overwhelming: But there are groups on the front lines.

We must demand accountability for the actions of those in power -- and recognize our repeated failure to do so in the past. It will take all of us, together, to fight for progress and heal the wounds our society has refused to acknowledge for hundreds of years.

We must demand structural change to address the systemic racism we‚Äôre seeing in the form of police brutality and our broken justice system.

And now, we demand answers as our President orders military force against Americans, peacefully protesting police violence.

America is in pain. But in this moment, we must find the strength to demand change.

As Democrats, we stand up for justice and accountability. That means we must demand justice for #GeorgeFloyd, #BreonnaTaylor, #TonyMcDade, #DavidMcAtee, and others for whom justice is owed.
